intro: Anthriscus candollei, commonly known as the slender cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Anthriscus candollei is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and its ability to attract pollinators.
